intro: Azalea kaempferi, commonly known as the Japanese azalea, is a flowering shrub native to Japan. It belongs to the Rhododendron genus and is characterized by its clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring, producing vibrant pink or red hues. It prefers acidic, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Azalea kaempferi is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
